title: Man in parked car charged with drug trafficking
text: LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) – A man acting suspicious drew the attention of a Louisville Metro police officer and a police K-9 found out why. According to an arrest report, Stephen Michael May was sitting in a car in the 4800 block of Cofer Avenue on the afternoon of October 12. When the officer spoke with him, the report says May gave him false information. During the investigation, the police K-9 gave officers hits in a number of spots of the car. After consenting to a search, police found $2,120 in cash under the drivers side floor mat. The search also revealed approximately 29 grams of crystal meth, some of which was packaged for sale, 55 hydrocodone pills, 12 xanax pills, .5 grams of a substance suspected to be heroin and drug paraphernalia. May, 42, was arrested on three counts of trafficking in a controlled substance. Copyright 2013 WAVE 3 News. All rights reserved.
